Judy Hopps is from the rural town of Bunnyburrow.
Judy Hopps becomes the first rabbit police officer in Zootopia, a city inhabited by anthropomorphic animals.
Chief Bogo assigns Judy Hopps parking duty on her first day at the Zootopia Police Department (ZPD).
Nick Wilde and Finnick are a pair of con artist foxes who hustle Judy Hopps during her parking duty shift.
Mrs. Otterton pleads with Chief Bogo to find her missing husband Emmitt, one of 14 predators who have gone missing in Zootopia.
Assistant Mayor Dawn Bellwether praises Judy Hopps for taking on the case of finding Emmitt against Chief Bogo's orders.
Judy Hopps arrests small-time crook Duke Weaselton for stealing a bag of crocus bulbs.
Judy blackmails Nick into helping her find Emmitt, as Nick was the last to see him.
Emmitt's belongings were found inside a limousine that Judy and Nick tracked.
The limousine is owned by Mr. Big, an arctic shrew crime boss whom Nick has a history with.
Emmett unexpectedly 'went savage' and attacked the limousine's chauffeur, Manchas, who is owned by Mr. Big.
Manchas explains that Emmitt yelled about 'Night Howlers' before attacking him.
Bogo demands Judy's resignation.
Nick reminds Bogo that Judy still has ten hours to solve the case.
As a child, Nick was bullied by his peers because they had prejudiced beliefs about foxes.
work together at City Hall to access Zootopia's traffic cameras and solve the case of missing predators.
both are involved in the case where Manchas is abducted by timberwolves
Judy and Nick locate Emmitt along with other missing predators while investigating the case.
Allows Judy and Nick to access these cameras in order to investigate the case of missing predators.
Work together at City Hall as Judy asks Nick to join her as her partner.
Allows Judy and Nick to access Zootopia's traffic cameras as Bellwether is also involved in the case of missing predators.
Leodore Lionheart had ordered their capture, which leads to Bellwether becoming the new mayor.
Leaves her job as a member of ZPD after implying that all predators possess physiology causing feral behavior.
Abandons Judy, who inadvertently incites fear and discrimination against predators throughout Zootopia with her comments.
Judy learns that Night Howlers are actually Midnicampum flowers, which have severe, lasting psychotropic effects if ingested.
Weaselton admits that a ram named Doug hired him to steal the Night Howler bulbs.
Aided by Mr. Big, they interrogate Weaselton and find out that Doug hired him to steal the Night Howler bulbs.
They find Doug in a laboratory hidden in Zootopia's subway, where he manufactures a serum from the Night Howlers to use against predators via a dart pistol.
Bellwether reveals herself to be the mastermind of a prey-supremacist conspiracy.
Judy and Nick become trapped in an exhibit, but Judy and Nick reveal that they had replaced the darts with blueberries and recorded Bellwether's confession.
Lionheart publicly denies knowledge of her scheme, insisting that imprisoning the infected predators was a 'wrong thing for the right reason'.
The predators are rehabilitated .
Judy is reinstated into the ZPD.
Months later, Nick graduates from the police academy, becoming Judy's partner and the first fox police officer.
Zootopia emerged as a concept to create something different from other animal anthropomorphic films, where animals either live in the natural world or in the human world.
Byron Howard pitched six story ideas to Disney Animation chief creative officer and executive producer John Lasseter, one of which was an all-animal adaptation of The Three Musketeers.

Byron Howard wanted to create something similar to Disney's Robin Hood, which also featured animals in anthropomorphic roles.

When John Lasseter suggested combining the 1960s theme with the animal characters, especially the space pug, Byron Howard developed and pitched Savage Seas, an international spy film centered on an arctic hare named 'Jack Savage' who was somewhat like James Bond.
Screenwriter Jared Bush was hired to work on the film, as he was excited to work on a spy film because his own father and grandfather had worked for the Central Intelligence Agency.

Research for the film took place in Disney's Animal Kingdom, as well as in major cities including New York City, San Francisco, Las Vegas, Paris, Shanghai, Hong Kong, and Brasília to develop a city that could actually be inhabited by talking mammals ranging in size from two inches (5.1 cm) to 27 feet (8.2 m) and from drastically different climates.
Research for the film took place in Disney's Animal Kingdom, as well as in Kenya and the San Diego Zoo Safari Park to study various animals' walk cycles as well as fur color.

In June 2016, Howard and Moore were in talks about the possibility of a Zootopia sequel.
In June 2016, Howard and Moore were in talks about the possibility of a Zootopia sequel.
On February 8, 2023, Disney CEO Bob Iger announced that a sequel to Zootopia was in the works during the Disney 2023 Q1 investors call.
Ginnifer Goodwin, who voices Judy, told CinemaBlend that she would like to see a role reversal between Judy and Nick in the sequel.

Ginnifer Goodwin told CinemaBlend about her idea for the sequel.
Jason Bateman, who voices Nick, also told CinemaBlend about his idea for the sequel.
Jason Bateman told CinemaBlend about his idea for the sequel.
On February 7, 2024, Iger revealed during the Disney 2024 Q1 investors call that the sequel will officially be called Zootopia 2, and will release on November 26, 2025.
On August 9, 2024, Ke Huy Quan was announced to be playing Gary in Zootopia 2.
On August 9, 2024, Ke Huy Quan was announced to be playing Gary in Zootopia 2. Yvett Merino set to produce.
